trans-unit.source: Represents the style of a submenu in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu"></xref> control.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> class to represent the style of a submenu in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control.
A submenu can be displayed within either a static menu or a dynamic menu.

A static menu is always visible on a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control, whereas a dynamic menu is displayed only when the user positions the mouse pointer over a parent menu item that contains a dynamic submenu.
You can specify different style characteristics (such as font size and color) for the submenus within a static menu and a dynamic menu by using the properties in the following table.
Submenu item style property
Description
The style settings for a submenu within a dynamic menu.
The style settings for a submenu within a static menu.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> class inherits most of its members from the `Style` class.
It extends the `Style` class by providing properties that control the amount of space around a menu item's text.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle.HorizontalPadding%2A> property to control the amount of space to the left and right of the menu item's text.
Similarly, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle.VerticalPadding%2A> property controls the amount of space above and below the menu item's text.
For more information on the inherited style settings, see <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style>.
Set the `z-index` of HTML objects that are associated with a submenu by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style.CssClass%2A> property of the submenu style.
The `z-index` attribute defines the stacking order of rendered HTML objects.
By default, dynamic menu items will appear above any HTML object that has the default z-index (0).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> class.
This constructor is commonly used when dynamically populating the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.LevelSubMenuStyles%2A> collection.

It is also used when extending the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> class to initialize the submenu item style properties, such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.DynamicMenuStyle%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.StaticMenuStyle%2A>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle"></xref> class with the specified view-state information.
Use this constructor to create a new <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> object with the information contained in the request's view state.
The view-state information of the current request.

Copies the style properties of the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> object into the current instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle"></xref> class.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle.CopyFrom%2A> method to duplicate the style properties of the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> object that calls this method.

All properties in the current instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> class will be replaced by the corresponding properties in the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object.
To copy style properties without replacing any set values, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle.MergeWith%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> object to copy.
Adds the style properties of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle"></xref> object to the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.CssStyleCollection"></xref> object.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle.FillStyleAttributes%2A> method to add the style properties of the current instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> class to the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.CssStyleCollection?displayProperty=fullName> object.
This method is used only by control developers.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.CssStyleCollection"></xref> object to which to add the style properties.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.IUrlResolutionService"></xref>-implemented object that contains the context information for the current location (URL).
Gets or sets the amount of space to the left and right of a submenu.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle.HorizontalPadding%2A> property to control the amount of space between the text of the submenu item and the side of the containing menu.
To control the vertical space between submenu items, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle.VerticalPadding%2A> property.
The amount of space to the left and right of the text of a submenu.
The default is 0.
The selected value is of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit.Type"></xref><xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType.Percentage"></xref> or is less than 0.

Combines the style properties of the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> object with those of the current instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle"></xref> class.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle.MergeWith%2A> method to combine the style properties of the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object with the style properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> object that this method is called from.

This method joins the style properties by setting each property that is not set in the current <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> object with its corresponding value in the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object.
Only properties that have not been set will be updated.

If a property in the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object is not set, the corresponding property in the current <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> object does not change.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> object to combine settings with.
Returns the current instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle"></xref> class to its original state.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle.Reset%2A> method to remove any defined style elements from the state bag and reset the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> object to its original state.
Gets or sets the amount of space above and below a submenu.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle.VerticalPadding%2A> property to control the amount of vertical space between the text of submenu items.
To control the horizontal space around submenu text, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle.HorizontalPadding%2A> property.
The amount of space above and below a submenu.
The default is 0.
The selected value is of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit.Type"></xref><xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType.Percentage"></xref> or is less than 0.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetAttributes"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can only be used when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> instance is cast to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection"></xref> containing the attributes for this object.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetClassName"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can only be used when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> instance is cast to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
The class name of the object, or `null` if the class does not have a name.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetComponentName"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can only be used when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> instance is cast to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
The name of the object, or `null` if the object does not have a name.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetConverter"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can only be used when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> instance is cast to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter"></xref> that is the converter for this object, or `null` if there is no <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter"></xref> for this object.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetDefaultEvent"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can only be used when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> instance is cast to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptor"></xref> object that represents the default event for the object, or `null` if the object has no events.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetDefaultProperty"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can only be used when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> instance is cast to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor"></xref> object that represents the default property for this object, or `null` if the object does not have properties.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetEditor(System.Type)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can only be used when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> instance is cast to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
A <xref href="System.Type"></xref> that represents the editor for this object.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> of the specified type that is the editor for this object, or `null` if the editor cannot be found.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetEvents"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can only be used when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> instance is cast to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptorCollection"></xref> that contains the events for this instance.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetEvents(System.Attribute[])"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can only be used when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> instance is cast to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
An array of type <xref href="System.Attribute"></xref> that is used as a filter.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.EventDescriptorCollection"></xref> that contains the filtered events for this instance.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetProperties"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can only be used when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> instance is cast to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection"></xref> that contains the properties for this instance.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetProperties(System.Attribute[])"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can only be used when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> instance is cast to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
An array of type <xref href="System.Attribute"></xref> that is used as a filter.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection"></xref> object that contains the filtered properties for this instance.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor.GetPropertyOwner(System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can only be used when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> instance is cast to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor> interface.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor"></xref> that represents the property whose owner is to be found.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the owner of the specified property.
